title: Here's why HBM is coming for your PC's RAM —  HBM consumes around three times the wafer capacity of DDR5 per gigabyte, as AI supercharges demand for chips and advanced packaging
summary: AI’s appetite for high-bandwidth memory is reshaping the global DRAM and NAND market, diverting wafer capacity and advanced packaging away from consumer products and driving sharp price increases across markets.

title: LG responds swiftly to user backlash, will allow users to remove Microsoft Copilot link from TVs — clarifies service is not an app, future update will include tile removal option from WebOS
summary: LG has clarified how Microsoft Copilot appears on its webOS smart TVs following recent coverage that described the feature as a non-removable app bundled into the operating system.

summary: Elegoo has slashed the prices on its 3D printers for the holidays, with up to 53% off.

title: Samsung Galaxy S26 series once again rumored to arrive in February
summary: Earlier today, Samsung made the Exynos 2600 chipset official, and this will be featured in some members of the upcoming Galaxy S26 family in some markets. Covering the event, a Korean publication has once again said that the S26 series will become official at some point in February, and will be unv…

title: Prusa Research introduces the Open Community License to protect open source 3D Printing hardware — new rules aimed at addressing industry abuses
summary: Full STEP and Fusion CAD files for the CORE One+ and CORE One L are now available on Printables under the new OCL license.

title: Helping to fight the RAM-pocalypse, this $470 Newegg combo pairs an Asus RoG Strix X870E-H WiFi 7 motherboard with 32GB of G.Skill Flare X5 Series DDR5-6000 RAM

title: HP Omen 34c G2 34-inch WQHD 180 Hz gaming monitor review: Delivering style, speed and value
summary: HP brings solid performance and value to the 34-inch ultra-wide segment with the Omen 34c G2. It’s a VA panel with WQHD 3440x1440 resolution, 1500R curve, 180 Hz, Adaptive-Sync, MPRT backlight strobe, HDR400 and wide gamut color.

title: From Helmand to Milan - Meenagh's quest for Winter Paralympic medal

summary: SK hynix first to validate 32Gb-based 256GB DDR5 module with Intel: up to 32.4W power savings per server, or millions of dollars per hyperscale data center.

title: China convicts 27 people for smuggling 166 tons of critical chipmaking element antimony — heavily-restricted mineral used for semiconductor manufacturing exported without licenses, court decides
summary: A Chinese court sentenced 27 individuals for illegally exporting antimony ingots without licenses, with authorities saying more than 166 metric tons were smuggled earlier this year.

title: French authorities arrest man for installing malware on a passenger ferry on behalf of 'a foreign power' — could have enabled external control of systems, including navigation
summary: French authorities have arrested a Latvian national suspected of installing malware aboard an Italian passenger ferry while it was docked in southern France.

title: North Korean hackers stole record $2 billion in crypto in 2025, including single heist worth $1.5 billion, report claims — rogue state accounts for 60% of all reported crypto thefts this year, $6.75 billion total since records began
summary: Blockchain analytics company Chainalysis says DPRK has set a record for 2025, with the regime expected to execute more sophisticated attacks in the future.
